pages.text: Most instruments in MIMI are hand-held instruments which can be played while being held in your hand.$(br2)By using a MIDI Input it is possible to play two hand-held instruments at the same time in your main and off hands.

pages.title: Opening the GUI
pages.text: A hand-held instrument can be played by right-clicking while holding the instrument in your main hand. This will open up the $(l:interface_instrument)Instrument GUI$(/l).$(br2)While the GUI is open you will be unable to walk around as your keyboard input will be used by the GUI to play notes.

pages.title: Playing without the GUI
pages.text: Hand-held instruments can also be played without the GUI by setting a MIDI Input on the instrument and then holding it in either your main hand or off hand.$(br2)The MIDI Input mode of the instrument in your main hand can be toggled by shift-right-clicking.$(br2)Player a hand-held instrument without the GUI will allow you to move while playing.

pages.title: Setting the Maestro
pages.text: If you want to set a player other than yourself as the Maestro for a hand-held instrument you can simply hold the instrument in your main hand and right click the player you want.
